greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is taken to be the smallest positive integer not already present which is consistent with the condition "n is a member of the sequence if and only if a(n) is a multiple of 3".
link: B. Cloitre, N. J. A. Sloane and M. J. Vandermast, Numerical analogues of Aronson's sequence, J. Integer Seqs., Vol. 6 (2003), #03.2.2.
B. Cloitre, N. J. A. Sloane and M. J. Vandermast, Numerical analogues of Aronson's sequence (math.NT/0305308)
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Mar 14 2003
